result.execSummary:
The defendant Lakeem A. Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lakeem A. Allen in court with attorney Kara Rolf.  Defendant Lakeem A. Allen in custody.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  VIS reviewed by all parties.  No contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

$543.00 fine or costs, 90 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
10 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, concurrent, forthwith
DNA sample
Paperwork handed in court.
Dane Co. jail
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on December 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe notes matter was to be a plea today but as DE hasn't appeared he will stand mute.  Atty Raabe then notes that NGP has already been entered.  Court notes matter will be placed back on JT calendar.
Plea hearing on October 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Raabe talked to ADA Mueller and had PTC but DE needs time to collect money to pay off condition precedent.  Requests plea hearing be reset.  Bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 14, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on September 8, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Recv'd offer.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.

Pre-trial conference on July 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.
Return date on July 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Taylor Hart intern requests reset so DE can get money together to meet condition precedent.  Requests new PTC/RD.  State objects.  Court resets one more time.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for July 28, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lakeem A. Allen in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai requests short reset.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Auth filed and approved.  Offer has been extended.  Payment up front prior or at plea.  Request 45 day reset.  State does not object to reset.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return date on April 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Lakeem A. Allen in court with attorney Adam Raabe.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request reset.  Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
